do not cut - make sure that you pull the yarn snug it may seem visible stitches & abbreviations when working but if done well just blends into the finished throw/blanket abbreviations us crochet terms chain chain counts as a stitch colour a uses 2 of the same whirl colourway when the first fdc foundation double_crochet colour a cake is finished this is your halfway point continue ldc long double_crochet with your second colour a cake starting at the same end of rs right side the cake your first colour a finished at so as to have a single_crochet single_crochet seamless colour continuation st s stitch es ws wrong side colour b uses 1 each of two different whirl colourways when your first colour b cake is finished continue in the pattern with special stitches your second colour b cake the third colourway ldc yarn over insert hook into indicated stitch or space in this case the chain two row below thus enclosing notes both that chain and the chain above yarn over and draw starting with fdc instead of chains can avoid the difficulty of up a long loop to the height of the current row of stitches twisted chains and produces a lovely edge 3 loops
